_A_TABLE_GROUP_SORT_DESCRIPTION_: A table that allows users to reorganize its rows based on the values in one or more columns, typically by interacting with column headers.
_A_TABLE_GROUP_SORT_DISABLED_DESCRIPTION: The parameter :disabled-sort="true" can be used to disable sorting functionality across all columns.
_A_TABLE_GROUP_SORT_LABEL_: Example of a table with three sortable columns
_A_TABLE_GROUP_SORT_MULTI_COLUMN_DESCRIP: Initial ordering can be based on more then a single column. The list of sortIds can be passed in the desired order to parameter model-sort. The numbering is then used to indicate sorting priority.
_A_TABLE_GROUP_SORT_MULTI_COLUMN_FIRST_N: The prop :show-first-sorting-sequence-number="true" can be used to display the number next to the primary sorting column, which signifies that the data in the table is currently sorted primarily based on the values in that column.
_A_TABLE_GROUP_SORT_MULTI_COLUMN_KEY_DES: Sorting by multiple columns is supported by using keyboard presses in combination with clicks. Key can be passed by using the prop sorting-multi-column-key.
_A_TABLE_GROUP_SORT_MULTI_COLUMN_KEY_HEA: Multi-Column Sorting with Custom Keyboard Keys
_A_TABLE_GROUP_SORT_OUTSIDE_DESCRIPTION_: Sorting outside of the component is supported, typically on the serverside,  with sorting parameters sent to the server and the sorted data received as a response, allowing for efficient handling of large datasets.
_A_TABLE_GROUP_SORT_OUTSIDE_HEADER_: Sorting outside of the component (server-side sorting)
_A_TABLE_GROUP_SORT_SEQUENCE_NUMBER_CLAS: CSS classes of the sort order indicator can be passed to match the visual aesthetics of the application, by using the prop sorting-sequence-number-class.
_A_TABLE_GROUP_SORT_START_DESCRIPTION_: Starting order refers to the predefined arrangement of rows when the table is initially displayed. SortId is to be passed to model-sort. Sorting is done by default in an ascending order, to sort the column in descending order, prefix the sortId with a minus sign.
